intro: Hieracium kolthoffianum, commonly known as the Kolthoff's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a discoid head. It is a perennial species that produces achenes as its primary means of seed dispersal.
